properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Warning issued February 16 at 1:30AM PST until February 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Choppy wind driven seas of 8 to 9 ft transition to swell
dominated and become less steep this morning. Seas become wind
driven again early Monday morning, becoming steep to very steep
and hazardous at 9 to 10 ft through Tuesday evening. Southwest
winds of 15 to 20 kt become north this afternoon and increase to
20 to 30 kt early Monday morning, persisting through Tuesday
evening.

* WHERE...The steepest seas and strongest winds will generally be
beyond 5 nm from shore, except closer to shore in the vicinity
of Cape Blanco. Late Monday afternoon through Tuesday evening,
advisory level conditions will generally be beyond 1 to 2 nm
from shore with warning level conditions expected beyond 5 nm
from shore.

* WHEN...For the current Small Craft Advisory, until 4 AM PST
early this morning. For the Hazardous Seas Warning, from 4 PM
Monday to 10 PM PST Tuesday. For the next Small Craft Advisory,
from 4 AM Monday to 10 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Very steep and hazardous seas could capsize or
damage vessels. Bar crossing will become especially
treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Recreational boaters should remain in port. Commercial vessels
should prepare for very steep seas and consider remaining in port
until conditions improve.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST TUESDAY
